definition: to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
separation of powers for checks and balances

sentences.english: The centralization and the decentralization in the old China competed and alternate mutually.
sentences.chinese: 旧中国中央集权与地方分权相互竞争，相互交替。

sentences.english: The second part introduces the history of the right of disposition.
sentences.chinese: 第二部分介绍了处分权的历史沿革。

sentences.english: But dispersed power easily cause a series of questions such as agent cost, social loafing etc.
sentences.chinese: 但分权容易造成代理成本和社会卸责等一系列问题。

sentences.english: School districts have made several attempts at decentralizing.
sentences.chinese: 很多学区已经开始尝试分权。

sentences.english: In this chapter, the United Nations Food and Agriculture Organizations(FAOs) experience with decentralization is briefly reviewed.
sentences.chinese: 简要回顾了联合国粮农组织的分权管理经验。

sentences.english: In fiscal decent system it is main means of competition bitewing local governments to offer high-quality public goods.
sentences.chinese: 分权财政下提供优质公共品是地方间竞争的主要手段。

sentences.english: Sellers' right of disposing does not affect the effect of the contract for sale.
sentences.chinese: 出卖人处分权不影响其买卖合同的效力。

sentences.english: This complex separation of powers contributes to the decentralization of government authority in the United States.
sentences.chinese: 这个错综复杂的分权结构促成了美国政府权力分散。

sentences.english: To realize the balance state, however, seperation of powers and checks and balances are effectual methods.
sentences.chinese: 而要实现这种平衡，分权制衡便是一种有效的手段。

sentences.english: Decisions that impact implementations should be decentralized.
sentences.chinese: 影响实现的决策应该分权。

sentences.english: Macro- control should comply with cardinal principles of"separation of powers"and"rule of law".
sentences.chinese: 宏观调控应当遵循“分权”和“法治”的基本原则。

sentences.english: The organizational structure is appropriately centralized or decentralized, given the nature of the entity's operations.
sentences.chinese: 视企业经营性质，看组织结构是否适当的集中或分权。

sentences.english: The current vogue is for decentralization.
sentences.chinese: 目前的时尚是要求地方分权。

sentences.english: Divided government is the best precaution you can have.
sentences.chinese: 分权政府是你们能采取的最佳预防措施。

sentences.english: Reform in China is characterized by regional division of power.
sentences.chinese: 中国的改革具有明显的地方分权特征。

sentences.english: The fourth part deals with the centralization and decentralization of finance in BQ Industry Group Corporation.
sentences.chinese: BQ工业集团公司财务集权与分权管理的研究。

definition: separation of powers for checks and balances
centralized power (history), e.g. under an Emperor or party
to check and balance (power)/checks and balances
property ownership or right/financial power/financial control
to act arbitrarily/to make decisions without consulting others
